questions.question: What is the difference between errors and exceptions?

answers.a: Errors are the ones which you can handle, and exceptions are those which you cannot handle
answers.b: Exceptions are the ones which you can handle and errors are the ones which you cannot handle
answers.c: Errors can be handled using try, except and finally bock and exceptions cannot be handled
answers.d: An error is a object with description of what went wrong and exception does not give you any description

explanations.a: Errors are the ones which cannot be handled by us, but exceptions can be handled using using try except block here
explanations.b: Exceptions are the ones which you can handle and errors are the ones which you cannot handle
explanations.c: Exceptions can be handled using try, except & finally block but errors cannot be handled
explanations.d: An Exception is a object with description of what went wrong and error does not gives you any description

questions.question: which of the scenario given below holds false for execution of the finally block?

answers.a: Finally block will get executed only when there are no errors is your program
answers.b: Finally block gets executed when there are errors in your program
answers.c: Finally block gets executed when there are exceptions in your program
answers.d: Finally block will always get executed irrespective of errors and exceptions encountered in a program

explanations.a: False:Finally block gets executed even when there is an error in your program here
explanations.b: True:Finally block gets executed when there are errors in your program
explanations.c: True:Finally block gets executed when there are exceptions in your program
explanations.d: True:Finally block will always get executed irrespective of errors and exceptions encountered in a program
